author: cnbc.com
title: Lee Hecht Harrison Continues Growth in San Diego Market
text:
SAN DIEGO, Feb. 21, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- Lee Hecht Harrison, the world's leading talent development and transition company, is pleased to announce the appointment of Charlene Ramey Hutchins to Senior Vice President of Business Development, a move that will continue to strengthen the company's market-leading profile in the dynamic and demanding San Diego market.
Charlene, who has more than 16 years of experience with LHH as a trusted human capital advisor and strategist, is passionate about developing and applying innovative human capital solutions that are specifically tailored to her client's long-term needs.
Prior to joining LHH, Charlene served as an executive recruiter at both client and candidate levels. She received her MBA from Pepperdine University, where she also worked as the Director of Administrative Services. Charlene earned her certification in Coaching from the Hudson Institute and her BS degree in Business Administration/Entrepreneurship from the University of Southern California.
Charlene is active within the HR community through her involvement with the San Diego HR Forum and SHRM. She has served on various boards and committees for non-profits including the San Diego Crew Classic and the Junior League.
"We could not be happier about Charlene assuming this new role," said Stan Tolliver, LHH Senior Vice President and Area Sales Director for Southern California. "Her years of experience in the human capital space give her unique insight into our core practice areas. She will lead a local sales team dedicated to serving the needs of organizations of all sizes and sectors. She continues to make our very strong team even stronger."
About Lee Hecht Harrison (LHH)
Lee Hecht Harrison (LHH) helps companies transform their leaders and workforce so they can accelerate performance. In an era of continuous change, successfully transforming your workforce depends on how well companies and their people embrace, navigate and lead change. Change within the organization, and their career. At Lee Hecht Harrison we use our expertise in talent development and transition to deliver tailored solutions that help our clients transform their leaders and workforce so they have the people and culture they need to evolve and grow. We are passionate about making a difference in peoples' careers and building better leaders so our clients can build a strong employer brand.
